name: 4. Terraform Destroy Pipeline Backend
# Step 4 which destroys the S3 and DDB bootstrap-backend infrastructure in backend.tf
on:
  workflow_dispatch:   # allows you to trigger manually

jobs:
  terraform-destroy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v3

      - name: Set up Terraform
        uses: hashicorp/setup-terraform@v3

      # Init with backend (this will connect to S3 + DynamoDB)
      - name: Terraform Init
        run: terraform init -input=false
        working-directory: AWS-Terraform/Project-5-Production-GitHubAction-Build/bootstrap-backend
        env:
          AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: ${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
          AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: ${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
          AWS_DEFAULT_REGION: us-east-1

      # Double check state (debug step, optional)
      - name: Terraform State List
        run: terraform state list || echo "No resources found in state"
        working-directory: AWS-Terraform/Project-5-Production-GitHubAction-Build/bootstrap-backend
        env:
          AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: ${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
          AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: ${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
          AWS_DEFAULT_REGION: us-east-1

      # Destroy using remote state
      - name: Terraform Destroy
        run: terraform destroy -auto-approve -input=false
        working-directory: AWS-Terraform/Project-4-Destroy-GitHubAction-Build/main
        env:
          AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: ${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
          AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: ${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
          AWS_DEFAULT_REGION: us-east-1
